alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Reeves County Plains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:11PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Reeves, northern Jeff Davis and southeastern Culberson Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Kent, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saragosa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 179 and 208. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Reeves County Plains
